revealed_to_reader: Dr. Amara Osei introduced - sociologist from Nova Station University
Amara is 32, grew up in Sector 8 (mid-level worker residential)
She escaped through education: 4 years undergrad, 3 years grad school, 2 years doctorate
Worked three jobs during grad school
Feels guilt about leaving community behind while studying their suffering
Keisha works in Sector 12 Community Relations
Building 7 community center is vibrant: art class, homework help, coding class, community garden
Amara conducted 12 interviews in first week
Amara's voice marker: says 'interesting' when disturbed
She tries to simplify academic language
Interviewed Yuki: documented transformation, 'value without productivity' quote
Interviewed Marcus: documented pain management, kids thriving, union history
Data patterns: labor down but satisfaction up, crime down, community cohesion up
Amara bought time, didn't send data to Board yet
Amara conflicted: career-making data vs data that threatens her funding
